title: Songhai and the Moroccan Invasion - context

content.question: Which of the following statements accurately describes one religious context of the Songhai Empire?

choices.label: The conversion to Islam by leaders of some African societies often resulted in their subjects blending aspects of this introduced faith with Indigenous spiritual beliefs and cosmologies.
The conversion to introduced faiths like Christianity and Islam was generally forced on the African population by colonizers from regions outside of Africa.
While Islam was widespread in North Africa, Christianity was more common in West Africa, leading to long-term conflict between the two regions.
Syncretic religious and cultural practices were largely rejected by African leaders, resulting in near-universal acceptance of the non-African traditions in Islam and Christianity.

content.answer: The conversion to Islam by leaders of some African societies often resulted in their subjects blending aspects of this introduced faith with Indigenous spiritual beliefs and cosmologies.
